subject: Make schema-agnostic db commands part of base API
commit_message:
Make schema-agnostic db commands part of base API

The various OVSDB schemas and CLI utils all support the same
basic DB operations: get/set/add/clear/destroy/find/list. This
patch requires all backend implementations to support these ops
and will allow any schema implementations sharing a backend to
share those operations.

Since the implementations are already subclassing the
backend-agnostic API definitions and the backend db ops are
backend-specific and schema-agnostic partial implementations
themselves, the options for implementing this were mixins or
composition. This patch chooses mixins despite their
(usually deserved) bad repution. The Backend operations all
require access to the class they are mixed into (or would
be composed into). In the end, composition ended up being
more work for a less useful result.

An implementation would choose the Idl backend ops like:
from ovsdbapp.backend import ovs_idl

class MyOVSIdlImpl(ovs_idl.Backend, api.API):

If any implementation doesn't specify a backend (like Neutron's
CLI implementation), then it must define the Backend db_*
methods in the implementation itself (like Neutron's CLI
implementation already does). This means this change should be
backward-compatible with projects using ovsdbapp.

Change-Id: Iec53837de1205ab48b16ac7dc9b6eebdd8c4c400

WIP: Straw man for new format for vendor data

Based on learning so far, introduce a new clearer version of the vendor
profile doc.

The goal would be that a vendor would publish this document in a
canonical public location. We'll also make a tool that would make it
easy for a vendor to have a template with just the choices they've made
and the tool would crawl the discovery urls for them. Also, a tool
that would do best-effort for a user to create a vendor profile doc if
their vendor does not have one.

This introduces a version to the document. We'll update occ to add a
version to the current ones but default to 1.0 if no version is given.
There is no intent to drop suport for 1.0, but the reading of 1.0 should
internally become translation into the new form.

This includes copies of all of the version discovery docs. The reason
for that is that those typically change very infrequently and take quite
a few API calls to collect- especially given that they are not linked to
directly. A release valve is there for clouds that _do_ expect
those documents to change more frequently than updating their profile
document would allow, or for clouds wanting to do staged-rollouts of
services and thus want users to hit the keystone catalog every time.

This is in yaml form for ease of reading, but like the current vendor
data I expect we'll land it in json format for ease of consumption by
all tools.

subject: placement: use separate tables for projects/users
commit_message:
placement: use separate tables for projects/users

We were a bit naughty in Iecbe0eb5717afb0b13ca90d4868a3ca5f9e8902b in
that we didn't normalize the storage of Keystone project and user
identifiers in the API DB's new consumers table. This means that we
will use a whole lot more storage for what ends up being very
repetitive data.

This patch changes the consumers DB table schema's project_id and
user_id columns from VARCHAR(255) to INT data type. This should result
in significantly faster queries for usage information since 9X the
index records can fit into a single index block in memory (36-byte
UUIDs stored in VARCHAR(255) versus 4-byte integers. The more index
records we can fit into a single page of memory, the faster both scans
and seeks will be.

Let's address this now before anything uses the consumers table.

Boot a VM in a subnet without gateway

1. What is the problem
We can create a subnet without gateway in the central Neutron, but when
we boot a VM in that subnet, the request fails since local Neutron is
trying to calculate the IP allocation pool based on the central subnet
gateway IP, which is None.

2. What is the solution for the problem
If a central subnet doesn't have gateway, do not re-calculate local IP
allocation pool when creating local subnet.

3. What features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to
realize the solution

subject: Gather all operations for the reservations table into the manager
commit_message:
Gather all operations for the reservations table into the manager

Records in the reservations table in the Blazar DB are created and
updated by both the manager and the resource plugin [1]. This results in
a lack of separation of concerns.

This patch migrates such operations from the resource plugin to the
manager. It makes the manager responsible for the reservations table,
and the resource plugin responsible only for resource specific tables
(e.g. the computehost_reservations table).

It also changes the resource_id field in the reservations table to hold
an ID of the record of resource-specific reservations tables, e.g.
computehost_reservations table for the physical-host plugin and
instance_reservations table for the new instance plugin [2].
An ID of resource itself which was held in the resource_id field is
migrated to the resource specific tables, so a new field 'aggregate_id'
is added into the computehost_rservations table.

The instance_reservations table of the new instance plugin is expected
to have resource IDs like a flavor ID, and aggregate ID, and instance
IDs. The ID of the record of the instance_reservations table is expected
to be held in the resource_id field of the reservations table.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/blazar-resource-plugin
[2] I03315216c3a6203e088e914ffb9fedf1e672d732

The old implementation for is_$service_enabled simply checked if any of
the subservices were enabled and if so the service was considered to be
enabled. This makes disabling services complicated as it means you have
to list every single subservice which can and do change over time.

services list and if so don't treat the service as enabled.

subject: Quotation marks should be included in http url using curl
commit_message:
Quotation marks should be included in http url using curl

I think using qutation marks in http url is more regular, even though
the current examples in the doc have no problem without qutation marks.
The doc is a manual of api curl, a user is likely to refer to
the manual and curl an another api which not in the doc.

For example:
curl -s \
     -H "X-Auth-Token:$OS_TOKEN" \
     http://loaclhost:5000/v3/role_assignments?user.id=$USER_ID&scope.project.id=$PROJECT_ID
response:
[1] 22894
-bash: scope.project.id=4f91eb36955543c9826b705bc5a90c59:command not found
...
The url has special characters such as '&', which can not be handled correctly.
Using double quotation marks in http url will be ok, like this:
"http://loaclhost:5000/v3/role_assignments?user.id&scope.project.id"

Change-Id: Id8f4c3cc64d298975ad81f8fc08abbec920a1e09

libvirt: Wait for abort_job to complete when not resizing

Change Ib4d65e88 added the ability to swap to a larger volume. In
doing so, we encountered https://bugzilla.redhat.com/1119173: "The
default behavor of abort block job with pivot flag isn't sync". This
was fixed in upstream libvirt stable version 1.2.7, but as
MIN_LIBVIRT_VERSION is currently 1.2.1 we still need to work round it.

However, this bug also affects defineXML(), which will also fail if
the block job is still executing. As we call this in the finally block
we need to wait for abort_job() to complete whether we're doing a
resize or not. To fix this, we unconditionally wait for abort_job()
to complete before continuing.

subject: Disable the nova-consoleauth service on HA.
commit_message:
Disable the nova-consoleauth service on HA.

When using the nova-cloud-controller charm in HA with the config
option single-nova-consoleauth set to true, its expected for the
nova-consoleauth service to be run in just a single unit at the time.

The service management (start/stop) is performed by pacemaker in
accordance with the cluster health using the OCF resource agent[0].

Its required for the service to be disabled by default on upstart (trusty)
or systemd (>=xenial).

This change disables the service by using the service_pause
charmhelpers call which considers both cases (upstart/systemd) when
the ha relation is present and the single-nova-consoleauth option is
used.

Also, this change fixes LP: #1660244 (Services not running that should be:
nova-consoleauth) by removing it from the resource_map when
ha + single-nova-consoleauth is used.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-resource-agents/blob/master/ocf/nova-consoleauth

subject: Unit test for asserting correct url in list_services
commit_message:
Unit test for asserting correct url in list_services

This commit enhances check_service_client_function with a new
arg called ``mock_args`` which can be used to assert that function2mock
was called with args/kwargs passed to ``mock_args``.

A docstring was added to check_service_client_function which includes
information for ``mock_args``:

:param mock_args: List/dict of expected args/kwargs called by
       function2mock. For example: If mock_args=['foo'] then
       ``assert_called_once_with('foo')`` is called. If
       mock_args={'foo': 'bar'} then
       ``assert_called_once_with(foo='bar')`` is called.

This means that more robust service client testing can be performed
to avoid errors in [0] from happening. This approach can also be
extended to not only self.get -- but also to self.post or self.put and
so entire payloads to the clients can be validated via unit testing.

An alternative (but worse) implementation is this:

    @mock.patch.object(services_client, 'urllib')
    def test_list_services_with_params(self, mock_urllib):
        self._test_list_services(type='fake-type')
        mock_urllib.urlencode.assert_called_once_with(
            {'type': 'fake-type'})

but all this does is assert that the params are url-encoded. It does
nothing to assert that self.get, for example, is actually called with
the right URL.
